MK: Jalan Tol yang Sudah BEP Tarifnya Tidak Boleh Naik
07 Nov 2019, 13:54 by Andi Saputra
Jakarta - Dalam waktu dekat, tarif jalan tol di sejumlah ruas akan naik. Namun Mahkamah Konstitusi (MK) memberikan pertimbangan bagi jalan tol yang sudah break event point (BEP) tidak boleh naik.
Pertimbangan MK itu tertuang dalam putusan Nomor 15/PUU-XVI/2018. Putusan itu diketok atas gugatan Prof Taufik Makarao dan Abdul Rahman Sabara yang menggugat Pasal 50 ayat 6 UU Nomor 38 Tahun 2004 tentang Jalan. Pasal itu berbunyi:

Konsesi pengusahaan jalan tol diberikan dalam jangka waktu tertentu untuk memenuhi pengembalian dana investasi dan keuntungan yang wajar bagi usaha jalan tol.

Menurut Prof Taufik dan Rahman, jalan tol yang pengelolaannya diserahkan kepada pihak lain semestinya memiliki jangka waktu konsesi yang pasti, sehingga keseluruhan pembiayaan pembangunan, operasional, dan pemeliharaan/perawatan jalan tol dapat dihitung tingkat break event point.
Dalam putusannya, MK menilai waktu konsesi tidak bisa dituangkan pasti dalam UU karena sangat tergantung dengan fakta di lapangan.
"Norma a quo akan lebih bisa disesuaikan dengan kebutuhan pemenuhan kebutuhan infrastruktur jalan dan juga kepentingan untuk mendorong pihak swasta terlibat membantu kelancaran program pemerintah memenuhi kebutuhan infrastruktur alternatif masyarakat," demikian bunyi putusan MK yang dikutip detikcom, Kamis (7/11/2019).

MK: Toll Roads that Have BEP Rates Cannot Increase
Nov 7 2019, 13:54 by Andi Saputra
Jakarta - In the near future, toll road tariffs on a number of sections will rise. However, the Constitutional Court (MK) provides consideration for toll roads that have a break event point (BEP) may not rise.
The Constitutional Court's consideration is contained in the decision Number 15 / PUU-XVI / 2018. The decision was made against the suit of Prof. Taufik Makarao and Abdul Rahman Sabara who sued Article 50 paragraph 6 of Law Number 38 Year 2004 concerning Roads. The article reads:

Toll road concessions are granted within a certain time period to meet investment returns and reasonable profits for the toll road business.

According to Prof. Taufik and Rahman, toll roads whose management is handed over to other parties should have a definite concession period, so that the overall financing of toll road construction, operations and maintenance / maintenance can be calculated at the break event point level.
In its decision, the Constitutional Court considered that the time of the concession could not be stated in the Act because it was very dependent on the facts on the ground.
"Norm a quo will be more adaptable to the needs of fulfilling the needs of road infrastructure and also the interest to encourage the private sector to be involved in assisting the smoothness of government programs to meet the needs of alternative community infrastructure," said the Constitutional Court's decision, detikcom, Thursday (11/07/2019).
